summary: This document is an email chain from September 2021 regarding a discovery request from the FBI Victim Services Division to its staff concerning the upcoming trial of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The request seeks contact information for victims, witnesses, and their attorneys to comply with discovery obligations for the USAO.

persons.name: Jessica D. Arbour
persons.context: Identified as an attorney for a victim in the Epstein/Maxwell case; her contact information was provided by an FBI staff member in response to a discovery request.

events.title: Scheduled Trial of Epstein/Maxwell
events.description: The New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell (case 50D-NY-3027571) was scheduled to begin trial.

events.title: Discovery Information Deadline
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division requested staff to provide contact information for victims, witnesses, and their attorneys by close of business for discovery purposes in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively gathering contact information for victims, witnesses, and their attorneys in preparation for the Epstein/Maxwell trial scheduled for November 29, 2021.
The discovery request required disclosure of all communications (texts, emails, voicemails) with victims/witnesses/attorneys to be turned over to the USAO.
Attorney Jessica D. Arbour is specifically named as legal counsel for a victim in the case.
The document highlights the procedural coordination between the FBI's victim services unit and the prosecution (USAO) ahead of a major trial.
The communication indicates a tight deadline, with information requested by September 13, 2021, for a trial set two months later.
